eds.preprocessing module¶

eds.preprocessing.adjust_skewness(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, specific: str = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Adjusts the skewness of all columns by finding highly skewed columns and performing a boxcox transformation

dfpd.DataFrame

DataFrame to adjust skewed columns in

specificstr, optional

Specfic feature to skew, by default None

pd.DataFrame

Returns the pandas DataFrame with corrected columns where skewness was high.

eds.preprocessing.apply_pca(x: numpy.array, n_comps: float = 0.975) → numpy.array¶

Apply PCA to the data according to the distribution of x_train

xnp.array

numpy.array to scale via its distribution

n_compsfloat, optional

Either the number of principal components, or the variance to be kept in the components., by default 0.975

np.array

X set of feature vectors with PCA applied.

Performs PCA on X feature matrix >>> apply_pca([[100, 200], [100, 100], [100, 0]]) array([[ 100.],

[ 0.], [-100.]])

eds.preprocessing.apply_scale(x: numpy.array, scale_type: str = 'Standard') → numpy.array¶

Scales the data according to the distribution of x

xnp.array

numpy.array to scale via its distribution

scale_typestr, optional

Which scaling type to use. Options: ‘Standard’, ‘Robust’, ‘MinMax’. Default = ‘Standard’

np.array

x properly scaled.

By default, the scale will standardize the feature vectors. >>> apply_scale([[-100, 10], [-90, 15], [-10, 20]]) array([[-0.82760589, -1.22474487],

[-0.57932412, 0. ], [ 1.40693001, 1.22474487]])

There is also a robust scaling option. >>> apply_scale([[100, 10], [0, 15], [5, 20]], scale_type=’Robust’) array([[ 1.9, -1. ],

[-0.1, 0. ], [ 0. , 1. ]])

You can also apply a MinMax scales which scales to 0 to 1. >>> apply_scale([[-100, 10], [-90, 15], [-10, 20]], scale_type=’MinMax’) array([[0. , 0. ],

[0.11111111, 0.5 ], [1. , 1. ]])

eds.preprocessing.convert_categorical_to_numbers(to_change_df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Dummifies all category data including objects. Assumes the data has been cleaned and the dtypes are consistent.

to_change_dfpd.DataFrame

pandas DataFrame to convert to all numerical

pd.DataFrame

Dummified input pandas DataFrame

eds.preprocessing.convert_objects_to_categories(to_change_df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Converts all object dtypes into categories

to_change_dfpd.DataFrame

DataFrame to convert objects to categories

pd.DataFrame

DataFrame with categories instead of objects

eds.preprocessing.get_moderate_correlations(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, col_to_correlate: str, moderate_value: float = 0.4) → None¶

Prints out all correlations deemed as moderate (0.4, or set by parameter).

dfpd.DataFrame

pandas DataFrame to check correlations from.

col_to_correlatestr

String that represents column we want to check correlations with.

moderate_valuefloat, optional

Which correlation value we deem as moderate (default 0.4)., by default 0.4

[dict]

List of dictionaries that contain the column name and its correlation.

eds.preprocessing.get_nan_col_proportions(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, lowest_proportion: float = 0.0) → [(<class 'str'>, <class 'float'>)]¶

Prints out all columns with NaN values that exceed a specific proportion (default 0.0)

df: pd.DataFrame

Input DataFrame to check column NaN rates.

lowest_proportion: float

Threshold for unacceptable NaN rate.

[dict]

List of dictionaries that contain the string of the column name and its NaN rate.

eds.preprocessing.remove_constant_columns(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Removes redundant constant columns from a dataframe.

dfpd.DataFrame

DataFrame to return without constant columns.

pd.DataFrame

Input DataFrame without constant columns.

eds.preprocessing.remove_nan_cols(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, prop_threshold: float = 0.0) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Removes columns from a DataFrame that have an unacceptable NaN rate.

dfpd.DataFrame

DataFrame to check column NaN rates.

prop_thresholdfloat, optional

Threshold for unacceptable NaN rate, by default 0.0

pd.DataFrame

DataFrame that removed the unacceptable NaN columns.

eds.preprocessing.remove_weak_correlations(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, target_col: str, weak_threshold: float = 0.1) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Removes weak correlations from a DataFrame.

dfpd.DataFrame

Input DataFrame to which remove weak correlations from.

target_colstr

Target column to check correlations with.

weak_thresholdfloat, optional

Threshold to consider a weak correlation, by default 0.1

pd.DataFrame

DataFrame without weak correlations.

eds.preprocessing.replace_missing_with_ml(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, col_to_predict: str) -> (<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>, <class 'dict'>)¶

Replace the missing values in the given column using machine learning predictions

dfpd.DataFrame

DataFrame to use as features (and predictor column)

col_to_predictstr

string that represents the predictor column

(pd.DataFrame, dict)

DataFrame with filled predictor column values via machine learning Also returns a dictionary containing performance information.
